abstract: The new film "Margin Call," which recounts 24 hours in the life (and near death) of an unnamed firm facing a Lehman-like crisis, may be one of the quietest films about Wall Street ever made. The New York Times's Michael M. Grynbaum compares the film to other cinematic takes on the financial crisis.

lead_paragraph: The new film "Margin Call," which recounts 24 hours in the life (and near death) of an unnamed firm facing a Lehman-like crisis, may be one of the quietest films about Wall Street ever made. The New York Times's Michael M. Grynbaum compares the film to other cinematic takes on the financial crisis. Read more »

headline.main: Wall Street, With Calm, Not Hysteria
